report_title: Industry Report on Garage Door Manufacturing
executive_summary:
Figures have been adjusted for inflation and are presented in 2024 currency.

Garage door manufacturers are a vital component of both commercial and residential construction, providing an easily overlooked but essential element in any property that seeks to include attractive parking. This industry has endured drastic swings recently because of the pandemic. Lockdown orders for nonessential businesses kept workers at home, bringing production to a standstill while downstream demand buckled under the overpowering economic uncertainty. Commodity prices fell off as demand shriveled but quickly rose as a resurging economy demanded more than could be supplied, making managing input costs all the more complex and pressuring profit. Industry revenue has dropped at a CAGR of 0.3% to $5.4 billion through the end of 2024, including an expected hike of 2.2% in 2024 alone.

Although commercial construction accounts for the majority of industry revenue, the health of both residential and nonresidential construction remains vital to this industry's performance. Commercial construction drastically fell during the height of the pandemic as businesses sought to cut costs and salvage whatever revenue they could. At the same time, residential construction received a substantial boost as consumer preferences shifted toward buying and renovating homes where everyone was stuck. According to the Remodeling Cost vs. Value report of 2023, garage door replacement remains one of the four home renovations that average a net-positive return once the resale value is factored in, aiding manufacturers. Residential construction has since fallen off while commercial construction has stabilized but is yet to return to growth, contributing to the slump in industry revenue even as the economy has healed.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: A Balancing Act Carries Garage Door Manufacturers Through The Pandemic
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: The US economy came to a screeching halt as COVID-19 swept the nation, as lockdown orders were put into place to mitigate the damage done by the virus. This brought business spending down rapidly, drastically reducing the value of nonresidential construction, and dragging down demand. Residential construction actually received a lift at this time, as consumer preferences shifted toward their living situations with so many other options cut off at the time. The balance between the drop in commercial construction and the rise in residential enabled this industry to stay afloat during the difficult times.

After pandemic-related disruptions faded, residential construction quickly fell back down. Consumers were able to return to their normal activities, drawing spending away from homes. The stabilization of commercial construction lured construction companies away from residential projects. This brought a substantial drop in revenue for garage door manufacturers, as commercial construction is yet to return to growth, throwing off the balancing act that carried them through the pandemic.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: INTERNAL AND EXTERNAL PRESSURES COMBINE TO DRAG THE INDUSTRY BACK
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Commodity prices fell drastically when demand was low but shot back up just as quickly as the economy reopened; since rapidly resurging demand outweighed low supply. These high commodity prices pressured profit, as the variety of materials used to make garage doors all experienced this increase. Trade conditions remain poor, as import penetration has risen while exports have fallen to almost negligible values, driven by low labor costs abroad and an appreciating US dollar. Consolidation continues in this industry, as the larger manufacturers are able to use their power to secure the largest commercial contracts and push out competitors.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: MANUFACTURERS INCORPORATE EVOLVING TECHNOLOGIES AND ECO-TRENDS
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Manufacturers have integrated emerging technologies like WiFi-enabled sensors and smart home automation into garage doors. These advanced innovations enable manufacturers to place a higher price on garage doors. Manufacturers have also adopted environmentally friendly designs to build garage doors. They have begun to use eco-friendly materials like metal composites and focused on energy-saving technology to build automatic garage doors.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: ECONOMIC GROWTH WILL REVITALIZE COMMERCIAL CONSTRUCTION
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: As the economy continues to improve, driven by increased business activity and rising consumer confidence, as pandemic-related disruptions fade further into the background, commercial construction will gain steam. Businesses will continue to start expansion projects that were put on hold during the pandemic while others will seek to capitalize on recent growth

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: THE COMPETITIVE HOUSING MARKET WILL KEEP DEMAND STRONG
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Even though the number of housing starts and the value of residential construction are falling back to prepandemic values, they will still continue to contribute to this industry's success. The housing market will hold strong as large investment portfolios are used to keep prices up. This will lead to an increase in the value of home improvements, of which garage door replacement is a high-value option.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: POOR TRADE AND PERSISTENT INFLATION WILL THREATEN FUTURE PROSPECTS
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Poor trade conditions will continue to be a hindrance to this industry, as even though the trade-weighted index (TWI) is set to fall back in the coming years, the high cost of transportation will keep exports at bay while the low cost of labor in Canada and Mexico will aid import penetration. Inflation has stayed high for some time now, and it's not going anywhere any time soon. While economic conditions are improving at the moment, rising interest rates and the slowly rising incentive to cut spending send to derail the growth provided by the improving commercial construction market.

Some manufacturers have begun incorporating AI and voice activation into smart garage doors. Companies will continue to adopt emerging technologies to differentiate themselves from their competitors. Companies will likely continue integrating new materials into manufacturing as eco-friendly needs mount. Also, industrial-scale 3D printers will likely be

industry_definition: The Garage Door Manufacturing industry includes operators that primarily manufacture garage doors. Manufacturers of garage door openers and installers of garage doors are not included in this industry.

positive_impact_factors: Barriers To Entry Level high - steady

key_trends: Differentiation is minimal. The large manufacturers are usually able to come out on top because they can afford to provide superior prices, large quantities and a wide variety of different doors.

Consolidation continues at a steady pace. As commercial construction heats up, larger manufacturers will gain strength that they can use to push out competition when demand inevitably drops back down.

Commercial and residential construction balance to support this industry. The improving economy will bring back commercial construction, driving growth as the residential construction that kept the sector afloat falls back.

More prominent manufacturers secure their hold on the industry. The ability to enter the commercial market, the most lucrative one for garage door manufacturers, helps the dominant manufacturers eliminate the competition.
Consolidation continues as the dominant manufacturers expand
The value of commercial construction dictates growth
Profit holds steady as different markets maintain demand
Wage costs drop as manufacturers downsize and consolidate
A high population concentration attracts garage door manufacturers
Commercial construction drives the most revenue

market_segmentation.segment_description: New residential construction, which includes homes and apartments, sustained the industry during the COVID-19 pandemic as commercial construction faltered.
The construction of new nonresidential structures is expected to account for most industry revenue, as many garage doors are associated with small- and large-scale commercial and municipal projects.

market_segmentation.segment: Maintenance and repair of existing buildings
market_segmentation.segment_description: Maintenance and repair of existing buildings is a crucial market for garage door manufacturers.

products_and_services.product_description: Sectional garage doors are one of the most popular types of garage doors for both residential and commercial projects.
Rolling garage doors are designed to roll up via a spring or manual chain and pulley system.
Canopy garage doors are popularly used by DIY professionals due to their straightforward functionality.

demand_determinants.determinant_description: Housing starts refer to the number of new privately owned housing units initiated within a given year.

international_trade_points.trade_title: Import Penetration Has Spiked in Recent Years
international_trade_points.trade_description: Despite fulfilling only a small domestic demand, import penetration has steadily risen.
USMCA participants Mexico and Canada benefit from free trade with the US.

international_trade_points.trade_title: Exports Don't Provide Much for Manufacturers
international_trade_points.trade_description: Exports have always been low in this industry.

international_trade_points.trade_title: WEATHER PROOF GARAGE DOORS ARE POPULAR IN THE CARIBBEAN
international_trade_points.trade_description: Garage doors are cumbersome, making them difficult to market overseas.

business_locations.location_description: The Southeast region is popular among manufacturers because of its proximity to major markets and well-developed transportation infrastructure.
California is a popular location for manufacturers.
The Great Lakes Region Houses a High Volume of Manufacturing.

regulations_points.regulation_title: THE RESOURCE CONSERVATION AND RECOVERY ACT (RCRA) SEEKS TO IMPROVE SUSTAINABILITY
regulations_points.regulation_description: Under the RCRA, the industry is responsible for assuring that appropriate water and solid waste discharge rules have been followed.

regulations_points.regulation_title: THE CLEAN AIR ACT (CAA) PROTECTS NEARBY RESIDENTS
regulations_points.regulation_description: The CAA establishes limits to air pollutants including carbon monoxide, nitrous oxides, sulfur oxides and other particulate matter.

regulations_points.regulation_title: THE CONSUMER PRODUCT AND SAFETY COMMISSION MONITORS THE QUALITY OF GARAGE DOORS
regulations_points.regulation_description: The Consumer Product Safety Commission requires that all garage door openers have reversing systems.

basis_points.basis_description: Differentiation is minimal. The large manufacturers are usually able to come out on top.

basis_points.basis_title: Consolidation continues at a steady pace
basis_points.basis_description: Consolidation continues at a steady pace. As commercial construction heats up, larger manufacturers will gain strength.

concentration_points.concentration_title: Consolidation continues as larger manufacturers win out
concentration_points.concentration_description: Although residential construction provides steady revenue, large manufacturers will secure contracts.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Purchase Costs Drop in the Face of Volatile Commodity Prices
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: The primary material inputs for garage door manufacturing are wood and metals.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Profit Fluctuates with Changing Conditions and Input Costs
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Profit grew during the height of the pandemic due to low input costs.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: WAGE COSTS DROP AS MANUFACTURERS DOWNSIZE
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: As consolidation continues, overall employment and wage costs have dropped.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: Labor intensity is high, as a large number of workers are required to operate the machinery.
Labor intensity is high with many workers required for production.

volatility_points.volatility_title: Fluctuations in the Construction Markets Dictate Revenue Trends
volatility_points.volatility_description: Construction fluctuations could disrupt the real estate market.

volatility_points.volatility_title: Consolidation Will Lead to Revenue Growth
volatility_points.volatility_description: As the industry consolidates, dominant manufacturers will outpace smaller competitors.

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: Low Levels of Innovation Continue to Define This Industry
technological_change_points.technological_change_description: The industry has maintained steady product functionality and design.

FAQs.question: Does your company specialize in one corner of the market or produce a diversified range of products?
FAQs.answer: Garage door manufacturers sell a variety of wood, metal, and plastic products.

FAQs.question: Are your sales heavily dependent on the health of the US economy?
FAQs.answer: Growth in housing starts and private spending on home improvements typically support industry sales.

FAQs.question: Has your company been exposed to volatile input prices over the past few years?
FAQs.answer: Growth in prices for wood pulp and steel will increase purchase costs for garage door manufacturers.

FAQs.question: Has your company explored acquisition opportunities in locations with well-established infrastructure networks?
FAQs.answer: As industry competition intensifies, merger activity is likely to increase.

FAQs.question: Have you been able to reduce wage costs by automating operations?
FAQs.answer: Wage costs in the industry are limited due to the implementation of various labor-saving technology.
